s.text: Other critics predict Microsoft's new bells and whistles will make no difference to the average user, who will consider the competing browsers "more alike than different" (Bruce Schwartz, USA Today ). Still others accuse Microsoft of predatory business practices, including ripping off the programming language Java from its competitor Sun.

Other critics predict Microsoft's new bells and whistles will make no difference to the average user, who will consider the competing browsers "more alike than different" (Bruce Schwartz, USA Today ). Still others accuse Microsoft of predatory business practices, including ripping off the programming language Java from its competitor Sun.

fascinating but wan way of life."
(For more on the veracity of Annaud's take, see Jared Hohlt's "Life and Art" in Slate.

Pile-ons: In a New Republic appreciation of his late friend J. Anthony Lukas, Alan Brinkley says Big Trouble is "a story told with such wit, energy, and grace that it becomes a riotous, sprawling historical entertainment."
A "preachy history lesson," says Leah Rozen of People . Other pans dwell on the film's sentimentalization of Tibet and its skirting of its protagonist's Nazism.

Book -- Big Trouble: A Murder in a Small Western Town Sets Off a Struggle for the Soul of America , by J. Anthony Lukas;
